create_graph_objects(objects: Iterable[Union[py2neo.ogm.Model, py2neo.data.Entity]])¶

create_nodes_from_dataframe(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, model_class: Union[py2neo.ogm.Model, str], chunk_size: int = 0) → pandas.core.series.Series¶

Create graph nodes defined in df table. Each row should contain data of a single node. model_class parameter determines the class/label of py2neo.ogm.Model/py2neo.Node that will be created.

Return a pd.Series with either py2neo.ogm.Model subclasses or py2neo.Node instances depending on model_class parameter. If model_class is a str the function will create a py2neo.Node instance for each row, where model_class value will be used as each node’s label and all the columns in the df will be transformed into properties. If model_class is an py2neo.ogm.Model instance but not the pandas2neo4j.PandasModel it must provide from_pandas_series() classmethod that construct a class instance given a pandas.Series containing a table’s row data. If model_class is a subclass of pandas2neo4j.PandasModel the __init__() will be triggered.

chunk_size parameter can be used if the df table is large and should be splitted into chunks when creating the nodes. It specifies the maximal numbers of graph nodes to be created within a single transaction. numpy.array_split function is used for splitting, so the size of each part may be different than the number passed as the parameter.

Parameters

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – A table containing data of nodes that should be created.

  • model_class (Union[ogm.Model, str]) – either py2neo.ogm.Model subclass or str determining the class/label that should be used to construct each object.

  • chunk_size (int, optional) – Maximal number of rows that should be converted into nodes within a single transation.

Returns

A pandas.Series with node objects of class determined by model_class param and properties provided in the df table.

create_relationships_from_dataframe(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, relationship: str, from_model_class: Union[py2neo.ogm.Model, str], to_model_class: Union[py2neo.ogm.Model, str], from_key_column: str, to_key_column: str, from_model_id_key: Optional[str] = None, to_model_id_key: Optional[str] = None, chunk_size: int = 0) → pandas.core.series.Series¶

Create relationships of type relationship between instances of from_model_class and to_model_class. Return a pandas.Series of py2neo.Relationship objects that represent each relationship in the table.

Relationships are listed in df: pandas.DataFrame where rows contain pairs of ids sufficient to identify the entities that should be connected. from_key_column and to_key_column arguments specify names of the columns that contain these ids. By default ogm.Model’s __primarykey__ is used to identify the nodes with id values, however other properties can be used by specifying from_model_id_key/to_model_id_key. These values are also required if from_model_class or to_model_class are not provided as a subclass of ogm.Model but a string with node label is provided instead.

chunk_size parameter can be used if the df table is large. It specifies the maximal number of relationships than can be created within a single transaction. Note that numpy.array_split function is used to split the table into chunks, so the size of each part may be different than the number specified in the chunk_size.

Parameters

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – A table with relationships key pairs. Each row should contain ids of already existing nodes in from_key_column and to_key_column columns.

  • relationship (str) – Name of the relationship that should be created

  • from_model_class (Union[ogm.Model, str]) – Either ogm.Model subclass (e.g. subclass of pandas2neo4j.PandasModel) or str with class name/label of py2neo.ogm.Model/py2neo.Node instances that should be starting nodes of each relationship.

  • to_model_class (Union[ogm.Model, str]) – Either ogm.Model subclass (e.g. subclass of pandas2neo4j.PandasModel) or str with class name/label of py2neo.ogm.Model/py2neo.Node instances that should be ending nodes of each relationship.

  • from_key_column (str) – Name of the column in df table containing ids of the relationships starting nodes.

  • to_key_column (str) – Name of the column in df table containing ids of the relationships ending nodes.

  • from_model_id_key (str, optional) – Name of the property that should be used to identify the node by value specified in from_key_column. If from_model_class is a ogm.Model subclass the __primarykey__ is used by default and this parameter can be omitted.

  • to_model_id_key (str, optional) – Name of the property that should be used to identify the node by value specified in to_key_column. If to_model_class is a ogm.Model subclass the __primarykey__ is used by default and this parameter can be omitted.

  • chunk_size (int, optional) – Maximal number of rows that should be converted into relationships within a single transation.

Returns

A pandas.Series with py2neo.Relationship objects for each row in the df table.

get_dataframe_for_label(label: str, columns: Optional[List[str]] = None)¶

Dump all nodes with label label available in the graph to pandas.DataFrame table. If only subset of nodes’ properties should be used to construct each row of the table one can specify them with columns parameter.

Parameters

  • label (str) – label of nodes that should be dumped to the table.

  • columns (List[str], optional.) – list of produced table columns names.

Returns

pandas.DataFrame which rows represent the graph’s nodes.

get_dataframe_for_models(model_class: py2neo.ogm.Model, columns: Optional[List[str]] = None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Dump model_class nodes available in the graph to pandas.DataFrame. The model_class must provide to_dict method that is used to construct a row for each node. If only subset of the dictionary items returned by the to_dict methods should be used one can specify them (and their order) with columns parameter.

to_dict method is provided by each pandas2neo4j.PandasModel instance.

Parameters

  • model_class (ogm.Model) – class of nodes that should be used to construct the table.

  • columns (List[str], optional.) – list of produced table columns names.

Returns

pandas.DataFrame which rows represent the model_class nodes in the graph.

get_dataframe_for_relationship(relationship: str, from_node_property: str, to_node_property: str, nodes: Optional[Iterable[Union[py2neo.ogm.Model, py2neo.data.Node]]] = None, inner_only=False) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Find all py2neo.Relationship objects representing given relationship available in the graph and construct a pandas.DataFrame table with their nodes. A single row in returned table describes a single relationship. For each matching relationship between nodes S and E use S[from_node_property] and E[to_node_property] as the corresponding row values.

If nodes argument is used construct the table only with relationships where one of the nodes is provided in the parameter. If nodes is used and inner_only is True use only relationships where both nodes are provided in nodes.

Parameters

  • relationship (str) – name of the relationship which objects should be used to construct the table.

  • from_node_property (str) – Name of relationship’s start node property that should be used in the constructed table in a row for corresponding relationship object.

  • to_node_property (str) – Name of relationship’s end node property that should be used in the constructed table in a row for corresponding relationship object.

  • inner_only – Boolean value determining whether both start and end nodes of a single py2neo.Relationship object should be available in nodes.

Parm nodes

Iterable of either ogm.Model or py2neo.Node nodes that should be start/end node of used py2neo.Relationship objects. If inner_only is True both start and end nodes of a relationship must be provided in nodes to include such relationship in the returned table.

Returns

pandas.DataFrame table that rows represent the available relationship objects in the graph.

get_graph_models(model_class: py2neo.ogm.Model) → List[py2neo.ogm.Model]¶

Return list with all model_class objects available in the graph.

Parameters

model_class (ogm.Model) – ogm.Model class which objects should be returned.

get_graph_nodes(label: str) → List[py2neo.data.Node]¶

Return list with all py2neo.Node nodes matching given label availbale in the graph.

Parameters

label (str) – label determining nodes to return.

get_models_for_dataframe(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, model_class: py2neo.ogm.Model, id_column_name: str, node_id_property: Optional[str] = None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Get all available model_class nodes matching rows of df table. For each row of the table return a single model_class object or None if a row could not be mapped to one of the graph’s nodes.

Parameters

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – a table which rows describe nodes that should be found in the graph.

  • model_class (ogm.Model) – the ogm.Model which models should be matched and returned.

  • id_column_name (str) – name of df table’s column which values should be matched with node_id_property property of nodes.

  • node_id_property (str, optional) – name of property that should be use to determine whether a particular node maps to a row of df table. If not provided map by property named with id_column_name.

Returns

pandas.DataFrame table which one column is a duplicate of df[id_column_name] and the other contains corresponding model_class objects.

get_nodes_for_dataframe(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, node_label: str, node_id_property: str, id_column_name: str) → List[py2neo.data.Node]¶

Match nodes in the graph with rows of df DataFrame. node_label is the label of nodes that should be used for the matching. From all of these nodes select ones with node_id_property property value available in the id_column_name column of the df DataFrame. Number of returned nodes may differ the length of df table.

Parameters

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – a table which rows describe nodes that should be found in the graph.

  • node_label (str) – label of nodes that should be mapped to rows of df table.

  • node_id_property (str) – name of property that should be use to determine whether a particular node maps to a row of df table.

  • id_column_name (str) – name of df table’s column which values should be matched with node_id_property property of nodes.

Returns

List with all py2neo.Node objects matching the rows of df table.

get_nodes_models_for_dataframe(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, model_class: py2neo.ogm.Model, node_label: str, id_column_name: str, node_id_property: Optional[str] = None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Get all available nodes in the graph with node_label label matching rows of df table. Cast the matching rows to model_class objects. node_id_property determines name of the property that is used to map nodes in the graph to rows of the table - if the property matches one of values in id_column_name column it’s going to be included in produced DataFrame. If node_id_property is not provided look for id_column_name property.

This function is especially useful if one has created some nodes in the graph based on df rows (e.g. with PandasGraph.create_nodes_from_dataframe() method) and wants to retreive the model_class objects in another execution.

Parameters

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – a table which rows describe nodes that should be found in the graph.

  • model_class (ogm.Model) – the ogm.Model class that should be used to wrap the matching nodes.

  • node_label (str) – label of nodes that should be mapped to rows of df table.

  • id_column_name (str) – name of df table’s column which values should be matched with node_id_property property of nodes.

  • node_id_property (str, optional) – name of property that should be use to determine whether a particular node maps to a row of df table. If not provided map by property named with id_column_name.

Returns

pandas.DataFrame table which rows contain ogm.Model objects as well as the value of property used to map these nodes.

get_relationships(relationship: str, nodes: Optional[Iterable[Union[py2neo.ogm.Model, py2neo.data.Node]]] = None, inner_only=False) → List[py2neo.data.Relationship]¶

Return list of py2neo.Relationship objects representing given relationship available in the graph. If nodes argument is used return only relationships where one of the nodes is provided in the parameter. If nodes is used and inner_only is True return only relationships where both nodes are provided in nodes.

Parameters

  • relationship (str) – name of the relationship which objects should be returned.

  • inner_only – Boolean value determining whether both start and end nodes of a single py2neo.Relationship object should be available in nodes.

Parm nodes

Iterable of either ogm.Model or py2neo.Node nodes that should be start/end node of returned py2neo.Relationship objects. If inner_only is True both start and end nodes of a relationship must be provided in nodes to include such relationship in the result.

Returns

List of py2neo.Relationship objects matching the relationship.

get_relationships_for_dataframe(df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, relationship: str, from_model_class: Union[py2neo.ogm.Model, str], to_model_class: Union[py2neo.ogm.Model, str], from_key_column: str, to_key_column: str, from_model_id_key: Optional[str] = None, to_model_id_key: Optional[str] = None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Map relationships described by df table with py2neo.Relationship objects available in the graph.

This method is useful if one has created the py2neo.Relationship objects based on a DataFrame values (e.g. with PandasGraph.create_relationships_from_dataframe() method) and wants to retreive these objects in another execution.

Parameters

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – table describing the relationships that should be mapped with py2neo.Relationship objects in the graph.

  • relationship (str) – name of the relationship that should be matched.

  • from_model_class (Union[ogm.Model, str]) – either ogm.Model or string with name of label determining nodes that should be used to map start nodes of the relationship.

  • to_model_class (Union[ogm.Model, str]) – either ogm.Model or string with name of label determining nodes that should be used to map end nodes of the relationship.

  • from_key_column (str) – name of df table’s column containing values that should be used to match the start node of each relationship

  • to_key_column (str) – name of df table’s column containing values that should be used to match the end node of each relationship

  • from_model_id_key (str, optional) – name of property that should be used to find matching start nodes in the graph. If from_model_class is a ogm.Model subclass this parameter can be omitted and the __primarykey__ of the class will be used.

  • to_model_id_key (str, optional) – name of property that should be used to find matching end nodes in the graph. If to_model_class is a ogm.Model subclass this parameter can be omitted and the __primarykey__ of the class will be used.

Returns

pandas.DataFrame table where a single row contains df[from_key_column], df[to_key_column] and py2neo.Relationship representing corresponding relationship.
